<<<<<<< HEAD
A collection of speeches made by Sir Edward Dering Knight and Baronet, in matter of religion. Some formerly printed, and divers more now added: all of them revised, for the vindication of his name, from weake and wilfull calumnie: and by the same Sir Edward Dering now subjected to publike view and censure, upon the urgent importunity of many, both gentlemen and divines. Dering, Edward, Sir, 1598-1644.
[6], 166 p. : port.
Printed by E.G. for F. Eglesfield, and Jo. Stafford, London : 1642.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A collection of speeches made by Sir Edward Dering Knight and Baronet, in matter of religion. Some formerly printed, and divers more now added: all of them revised, for the vindication of his name, from weake and wilfull calumnie: and by the same Sir Edward Dering now subjected to publike view and censure, upon the urgent importunity of many, both gentlemen and divines. Dering, Edward, Sir, 1598-1644.
[6], 166 p. : port.
Printed by E.G. for F. Eglesfield, and Jo. Stafford, London : 1642.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
F. Eglesfield
